item.title: NGO/NON-PROFIT COMMUNICATION
item.description: Visuals concieved for non-profit initiatives working in the fields of climate change mobilization and refugee rights, based in Paris, France.

item.title: MOTION DESIGN/3D ANIMATION
item.description: A compilation of 2D, 3D, and motion design work from between 2015-2019.

item.title: FRANCE-AMÉRIQUE / ALLIANCE FRANÇAISE OF NEW YORK
item.description: A selection of visuals conceived for communication purposes on behalf of the New York-based bilingual magazine France-Amérique, and their partner organization l’Alliance Française of New York.

item.title: LOGOS, ILLUSTRATIONS, CONCEPT ART
item.description: Logos, illustrations and concept art created for various businesses, print, and animated film projects.

item.title: About me
item.description: Kelly Odette Dochy is a French/Mexican-American artist, activist, and poet, currently residing in Paris, France. Holding a B.A. in 3D film conception-direction from the LISAA Paris in 2015, she then worked there as the international department’s film development teacher. She initiated projects with the children’s rights NGO Enfance Majuscule, on videos against child abuse, and with the Mayor’s office of Paris’ 10th arrondisement, for an illustration series envisioning a Paris as a climate change resilient city in the year 2050.

item.title: Code of ethics
item.description: Infin8ty is an initiative aiming to use art and media to catalyse awareness, and action on a diversity of societal issues, by rewriting old narratives, sharing a diversity of perspectives, and imagining alternate futures. 1 Infin8ty is an emerging project, collaborative and decentralized. 2 Encouraging diversity as an ingredient for resilience, Infin8ty wishes to work with individuals and organizations from diverse walks of life. 3 Quality and sustainability. “Less is more”.
